summary: The LIHEAP Staffing Support Act amends the Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Act of 1981. It mandates that the Secretary of Health and Human Services employ a minimum number of staff to administer the LIHEAP program, with a higher staffing requirement during emergencies. It also limits the percentage of staff who can be contractors, except during emergencies. The bill aims to ensure adequate staffing for the effective operation of the low-income home energy assistance program.
